history.content:
*posted on behalf of Professor Ranade*

CalMentors: Mentor younger students as they navigate online learning!

As we all figure out how to get used to remote learning and remote teaching, younger students in middle-school and high-school are facing even more significant challenges. SWE and TBP are working with Prof. Gireeja Ranade to jointly organize a new program CalMentors, where we can together support younger students in their learning through remote mentoring. 
 
Why mentor?
School closures around the country will have a negative impact on student learning and will disproportionately impact those with fewer resources. As we look forward to making sure we fix all holes in the STEM pipeline, it is important that we mitigate the impact of these closures. Conversations with teachers from Bay Area schools have shown that this support is truly needed and will help students stay on track as they navigate online learning.
Structure
The structure of this program will consist of weekly, hour-long tutoring sessions focused on one specific subject. Each session will have two tutors (so you'll get to meet and know other Cal students as well) and 4-5 high-school/middle-school students. The minimum commitment we ask is 1 hour per week, but you may choose to teach multiple sections if you’d like. 
Additionally, before your first teaching session, you will need to attend a quick orientation with our advisor (Professor Gireeja Ranade). Tutor signups will close next Friday, September 11th. We hope to have the program begin by Monday, September 21st. You might also need to complete a short CANRA training, and we will send details about this shortly. 
Sign Up
Sign up to be a tutor with this Google form! We have slots from Monday to Friday, from 4-5PM or 7-8PM. The subject you’ll teach and your time slot will be determined based on everyone’s availability, so mark all topics you’re comfortable with and all times you’re free. Please fill this out by next Friday, September 11th, but let us know if you need an extra day or so and we will try to make it work.
Please feel free to contact the program coordinators at calmentors.berkeley@gmail.com with any questions or concerns. Thank you so much for your interest in supporting younger students, and we look forward to serving the Berkeley community with you all!
